Comment: I’m not saying they aren’t grossly and criminally incompetent and corrupt, but how does a Russian asset become POTUS?  The Obama administration didn’t have enough intel to do something about it?  The four years of Biden administration couldn’t uncover anything?    Yes, jailing a political opponent or suspending an election is a bad image, but it’s better than letting these dipshits get the keys and shred everything while they throw THEIR political opponents in an el Salvadoran gulag.  At least they’d have evidence over the bullshit the current administration is pulling.    Is Trump a Russian asset?  Maybe, but we’ve got way worse problems than that if that’s the case, because fundamentally every person involved, even the ones who are supposed to prevent this from happening, have been compromised, and if that’s the case, why even bother covering it up?  At least if there is solid evidence we wouldn’t be pulling the same conspiratorial nonsense the right does.  At least the rest of the world could take a lesson about not letting these guys in to power because they will abolish the rule of law day 1.  Instead, we’re stuck where we are with the only thing we can absolutely say for certain is that the US is so stupid and corrupt we just let this happen, because in the vast international conspiracy not one single person can drop some actual evidence.  That’s the same shit we use to debunk moon landing denialists.

Comment: But there is evidence. There’s piles and piles and that is not an exaggeration. I mean cmon why even say it was a peaceful protest? There’s another obvious lie that they just expect their base to eat up while pissing off the entire world.  And then what happened? Nothing. Because rules and laws don’t matter when the people who are supposed to uphold them don’t. Evidence for everything they do doesn’t matter when trump goes on tv and says the opposite and then Fox runs with it while also making sure you understand that everything dems say is made up and trying to hurt you and your dear leader.
